<title level="1" right="Hazard 0" pfs="">[Hidden Pit](/Hazards.aspx?ID=474)</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Mechanical" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=105" />
<trait label="Trap" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=158" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [GM Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=218) pg. 102 <sup>2.0</sup>

**Complexity** Simple

</column>

A wooden trapdoor covers a pit that’s 10 feet square and 20 feet deep.

---

**Stealth**
DC 18 (or 0 if the trapdoor is disabled or [broken](/Conditions.aspx?ID=60))

**Disable**
DC 12 [Thievery](/Skills.aspx?ID=50) to remove the trapdoor

<column gap="tiny">

**AC** 10, **Fort** +1, **Ref** +1

**Trapdoor Hardness**
3

**Trapdoor HP**
12 (BT 6)

**Immunities**
[critical hits](/Rules.aspx?ID=2190), [object immunities](/Rules.aspx?ID=2161), precision damage

</column>

**Pitfall** <actions string="Reaction" /> **Trigger** A creature walks onto the trapdoor; **Effect** The triggering creature falls in and takes falling damage (typically 10 bludgeoning damage). That creature can use the [Grab an Edge](/Actions.aspx?ID=2313) reaction to avoid falling.

---
**Reset**
Creatures can still fall into the trap, but the trapdoor must be reset manually for the trap to become hidden again.
